meanings.definition: Derived from two separate ancestral lines.
meanings.sent1: The diphyletic species showed traits from both of its ancestors.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the diphyletic nature of the ancient species.
meanings.sent3: It was quite interesting to see how the diphyletic traits combined in the new species.
meanings.sent4: The diphyletic origins of the creature were like a genetic puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The diphyletic heritage of the plant made it unique among its peers.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by two distinct evolutionary lineages.
meanings.sent1: The diphyletic evolution of the birds fascinated the researchers.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed fossils showcasing the diphyletic history of mammals.
meanings.sent3: The diphyletic path of the insects led to some unexpected discoveries.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the diphyletic trees stood as a testament to ancient times.
meanings.sent5: The diphyletic development of the fish was a marvel of nature.
